text: Dame Aroha Hōhipera Reriti-Crofts (née Crofts; 28 August 1938 – 20 May 2022) was a New Zealand community activist. She was the national president of the Māori Women’s Welfare League from 1990 until 1993. She was the active community worker for the Māori in New Zealand. Reriti-Crofts was born in Tuahiwi, New Zealand. Reriti-Crofts died on 20 May 2022 in Christchurch, New Zealand at the age of 83. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Māori rights activists Category:People from Christchurch
title: Aroha Reriti-Crofts
